intro: Cardia montana, commonly known as the mountain cardia, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust stem structure. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated for traditional herbal use.
